list_definition.definition: (abbreviation hanky, plural hankies or hankieˈhaŋki) a small usually square piece of cloth or paper tissue used for wiping or blowing one’s nose into

list_ex_of_english: They cover practically all clothing, boots, shoes, handkerchiefs, braces, furniture, pillows and mattresses.
Sharing everything with your neighbours, haven't even got a bit of garden to call your own except for that pocket handkerchief out there.
On reception prisoners are given two clean shirts, two clean pairs of socks and one clean handkerchief.
Yet the ' as now understood ' of the second sentence was the handkerchief beneath which the conjuring trick was accomplished.
Disinfection by boiling all linen, especially pillowcases, handkerchiefs and sheets, as well as plenty of good food and open fresh air, was also recommended.
This time he dashed at them with a clean handkerchief.
A pipe-maker was robbed of his muslin cravat, striped handkerchief, leather shoes and iron buckles.
Just before they moored, the mate went downstairs and changed out of his bargee's clothes into a blue serge suit and a nice knotted handkerchief.
